fields.name: getConversationMessages
fields.description: Get messages for the desired conversation in a descencing order

fields.name: getUserMessages
fields.description:
Get messages by User ID
############### this query will return all the messages for the user without grouping them by conversation, the will be orderd by ID.

fields.name: getUserConversations
fields.description: Returns a list of all the conversations that the user is a participant in

fields.name: getUserConversations_dep
fields.description: (Deprecated)  Returns a list of all the conversations that the user is a participant in

fields.name: getUserConversations_BassamTest
fields.description: (This is for bassam to test)  Returns a list of all the conversations that the user is a participant in

fields.name: getUserOnlineStatus
fields.description: Get the online status of

types.name: Message
types.description: Return type for addMessage and any other mutation/query that return a message information

fields.name: message_id
fields.description: Message ID in the server DB

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User ID of the sender

fields.name: conv_type
fields.description: n/a

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: n/a

fields.name: local_id
fields.description: Message ID in the local database of the sender client i.e Mobile Application

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Message status Enum values :
############### 0 : SENT
############### 1 : SEEN

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Unix timestamp

fields.name: text
fields.description: Message text

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the attachment, link, gif

fields.name: url_title
fields.description: URL preview Title

fields.name: url_thumb_url
fields.description: URL preview thumb

fields.name: url_domain
fields.description: URL preview domain

fields.name: url_text
fields.description: URL preview text

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: Conversation ID

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Unix timestamp

fields.name: peer_user
fields.description:
The other user that is participant in the conversation
######## In case It's returend from startConversation or getUserConversation; the peer_user will not be the sender/requests

types.name: User
types.description: User Profile Object which will be populated from Uhive Main database

types.name: Conversation
types.description: Return type for startConversation and startSupportConversation

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: n/a

fields.name: sender_id
fields.description: User ID of the craetor

fields.name: receiver_id
fields.description: User of the targeted user

fields.description: Conversation ID

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: # # Unix timestamp

fields.name: peer_user

# The other user that is participant in the conversation

types.name: SignalOnlineStatus
types.description: Return type for changeOnlineStatus and getUserOnlineStatus

fields.name: last_seen
fields.description: Unix timestamp in seconds

fields.name: is_online
fields.description: Detemines whether the user last_seen is no more 5 seconds past from the time of calling getUserOnlineStatus

fields.name: startConversation
fields.description:
Start a conversation between two users
########### The receiver user will get be notified of new conversation through the subscription

fields.name: startSupportConversation
fields.description: Start a conversation with Uhive support agent

fields.name: setSeenConversation
fields.description: Set all message before "last_msg_seen_id"<Int> as seen in a conversation

fields.name: addMessage
fields.description: Send message to a conversation, the "receiver_id"<Int> will determine which user will recieve this message

fields.name: publishTyping
fields.description: Publish typing so the other parties of the conversation will know when you started typing and when you finished

fields.name: changeOnlineStatus
fields.description: Specifies whether the user is online of offline, this will persist in the database so other users can query about it

types.name: UserIdGenericOutput
types.description:
UserIdGenericOutput is a return type for most of mutations
############### Its a return type for the subscription too, its been developed to unified the subsciptions into one subscription

fields.name: action_type
fields.description:
action_type Enum values :
############### 0 : NEW_MESSAGE
############### 1 : TYPING
############### 2 : SEEN
############### 3 : NEW_CONVERSATION
############### 4 : JOINED_FOR_GROUP_CONVERSATION

fields.name: receiver_id
fields.description: The User ID that will receive this output through subscribeByUserID

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message body in case if action_type is 0

fields.name: typing
fields.description: Typing infromation in case if action_type is 1

fields.name: seen
fields.description: Seen information in case of action_type = 2

fields.name: conversation
fields.description: New-Conversation in case of action_type = 3

types.name: TypingCommiter
types.description:
This will be returned as a field in UserIdGenericOutput
############### It holds information about who published typing

fields.name: action
fields.description:
Action Enum values :
############### 0 : START_TYPING
############### 1 : STOP_TYPING

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: Conversation ID that the typing happened within

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: User ID that committed the typing action

types.name: SeenOutput
types.description: Returned as a field in UserIdGenericOutput

fields.name: last_msg_seen_id
fields.description: Message ID of the last seen message on the other client

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: The conversation which the other client marked as seen

types.name: ConversationsListItem_startConversation
types.description: Return type for getUserConversations and startConversation

fields.name: conversation_id
fields.description: Conversation ID

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: Unix timestamp

fields.name: peer_user
fields.description:
The other user that is participant in the conversation
######## In case It's returend from startConversation or getUserConversation; the peer_user will not be the sender/requests

fields.name: subscribeByUserID
fields.description:
- This is generic subscription for all actions
############### - The cleint will subscribe for this topic and all the actions will be recieved through this channel
############### - This subscription will be attached for the following mutations :
############### - addMessage
############### - publishTyping
############### - setSeenConversation
############### - newGroupAdded
############### - The subscriber will receive a message when someone calls any of the preceeded mutations
############### - The "receiver_id" in any of the preceeded mutations should should match the receiver_id(which is your User ID as a subscriber) of this subscription.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema SDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar SDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface SDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum SDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum value SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object SDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field SDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

directives.name: aws_auth
directives.description: Directs the schema to enforce authorization on a field

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_oidc
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an OIDC token.

directives.name: aws_cognito_user_pools
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by a Cognito User Pools token.

args.name: cognito_groups
args.description: List of cognito user pool groups which have access on this field

directives.name: aws_publish
directives.description: Tells the service which subscriptions will be published to when this mutation is called. This directive is deprecated use @aws_susbscribe directive instead.

args.name: subscriptions
args.description: List of subscriptions which will be published to when this mutation is called.

directives.name: aws_subscribe
directives.description: Tells the service which mutation triggers this subscription.

args.name: mutations
args.description: List of mutations which will trigger this subscription when they are called.

directives.name: aws_api_key
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by an API key.

directives.name: aws_iam
directives.description: Tells the service this field/object has access authorized by sigv4 signing.
